{{Infobox military conflict |conflict = Damascus offensive (2013) |partof = the [[Syrian civil war]] ([[Rif Dimashq Governorate campaign]]) |image = [[File:Damascus offensive (February 2013).svg|290px]] |caption = Frontlines in Rif Dimashq from February to March 2013 {{leftlegend|#EDC4BE|Syrian Government control}} {{leftlegend|#CDEBC9|Opposition control}} {{leftlegend|#B6A25F|Contested}} |date = 6 February – 25 March 2013
({{Age in years, months, weeks and days|month1=2|day1=6|year1=2013 |month2=3 |day2=25 |year2=2013}}) |place = [[Damascus]], [[Syria]] |result = Partial rebel victory *Rebels capture parts of the ring road on the edge of Damascus and enter the city's Jobar district in early February *Rebels advance into the Qaboun and Kafar Souseh districts in late March{{cite web|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/03/25/us-syria-crisis-damascus-idUSBRE92O07320130325 |title=Syrian rebels bombard central Damascus, army artillery hits back |publisher=Reuters |date=2013-03-25 |accessdate=2013-12-07}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2013/Mar-28/211734-assad-appeals-to-brics-countries-to-help-end-war.ashx#axzz2Ou2ZayAu |title=Assad appeals to BRICS countries to help end war | News , Middle East |publisher=The Daily Star |date=2013-03-28 |accessdate=2013-12-07}} *Government forces launch a [[Rif Dimashq offensive (March 2013–present)|counter-offensive]] to the east of Damascus in late March{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/least-15-civilians-including-child-have-died-shelling-towns-east-damascus-monitoring |title=At least 15 civilians, including a child, have died in shelling of towns east of Damascus, a monitoring group has said. - Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.com |date=2013-04-08 |accessdate=2013-12-07}}{{cite web|last=Holmes |first=Oliver |url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/04/08/us-syria-crisis-idUSBRE9370II20130408 |title=Suicide car bomber kills 15 in central Damascus |publisher=Reuters |date=2013-04-08 |accessdate=2013-12-07}} |combatant1 = [[File:SyrianNationalCoalitionOfficialLogo.svg|23px]] [[National Coalition for Syrian Revolutionary and Opposition Forces|Syrian Coalition]] *{{flagicon|Syria|1932}} [[Free Syrian Army]] * [[Syrian Islamic Front]]{{cite news|title=BBC Arabic: Groups affiliated to al-Qaeda carry out acts of terror |url=http://www.champress.net/index.php?q=en/Article/view/7707 |publisher=Champress |date=18 September 2012 |accessdate=21 September 2012}} **[[Ahrar ash-Sham]] **Kataib Hamza ibn Adulmutallib *[[Syrian Islamic Liberation Front]] **[[Liwa Al-Islam]] *[[File:Flag of the Al-Nusra Front.svg|23px]] [[Al-Nusra Front]]{{cite news|title=Rebels fighting against al-Assad rule fragmented, disorganized in Syria |url=http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/images/Documents/F199BC38846F4E72B083A4222B568E7F.pdf |last=Yezdani |first= İpek |newspaper=[[Hürriyet Daily News]] |date=2 September 2012 |accessdate=22 September 2012}} |combatant2 = {{flagicon|Syria}} [[Syrian government]] *{{flagicon image|Flag of the Syrian Arab Armed Forces.svg}} [[Syrian Armed Forces]] {{flagicon image|PFLP-GC Flag.svg}} [[Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine – General Command|PFLP – GC]]{{cite news|url=https://now.mmedia.me/lb/en/nowsyrialatestnews/syria_hits_back_at_un_over_palestinian_refugees_|title=Syria hits back at UN over Palestinian refugees |last=AFP|date=17 December 2012|work=Syria|publisher=NOW.|accessdate=17 December 2012}}
{{flagicon image|Liwa Abu al-Fadhal al-Abbas SSI.svg}} [[Liwa Abu al-Fadhal al-Abbas]]{{cite news|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Middle-East/2013/0118/Video-appears-to-show-Hezbollah-and-Iraqi-Shiites-fighting-in-Syria|title=Video appears to show Hezbollah and Iraqi Shiites fighting in Syria|last=Blanford|first=Nicholas|date=18 January 2013|publisher=Christian Science Monitor|accessdate=4 February 2013}} |commander1= Khaled al-Haboush

(Republican Guard Brigade 104 commander)

{{flagicon|Syria}} Ali Smender (National Defence Front for Syria){{KIA}}{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/syriahroe/posts/337182226390122 |title=Preliminary death toll for 13/2/2013:... - Syrian Observatory for Human Rights |publisher=Facebook |date=2013-02-13 |accessdate=2013-12-07}} |units1=[[Damascus Military Council]] |units2=1st Armoured Division
[[3rd Armoured Division (Syria)|3rd Armoured Division]]

14th Special Forces Division
[[Republican Guard (Syria)|Republican Guard]] |strength1= 4,500 fighters{{cite web|url=http://english.ruvr.ru/2013_01_10/Heavy-fighting-continues-in-Mliha-near-Damascus/ |title=Heavy fighting continues in Mliha near Damascus - News - Society - The Voice of Russia: News, Breaking news, Politics, Economics, Business, Russia, International current events, Expert opinion, podcasts, Video |publisher=: |date= |accessdate=2013-12-07}} *750–1,000 al-Nusra fighters{{cite news|title=Al-Qaeda affiliate playing larger role in Syria rebellion |url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/post-partisan/post/al-qaeda-affiliate-playing-larger-role-in-syria-rebellion/2012/11/30/203d06f4-3b2e-11e2-9258-ac7c78d5c680_blog.html |last=Ignatius |first=David |authorlink=David Ignatius |newspaper=[[Washington Post]] |date=30 November 2012 |accessdate=1 December 2012}} |strength2= 70,000 soldiers,{{cite web|last=Yacoub |first=Khaled |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2013/01/13/uk-syria-crisis-idUKBRE90B08F20130113 |title=Syrian forces kill dozens in bombardments - opposition | Reuters |publisher=Uk.reuters.com |date= |accessdate=2013-12-07}} 1000+ tanks |casualties1= 735+ fighters killed{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/ |title=المرصد السورى لحقوق الانسان |publisher=Syriahr.com |date= |accessdate=2013-12-07}} |casualties2= 440+ soldiers killed |casualties3= }} {{Campaignbox Syrian uprising}} {{Campaignbox Rif Dimashq Campaign}} The '''Damascus offensive (2013)''' refers to a series of rebel operations{{cite web | url=http://www.understandingwar.org/backgrounder/syria-update-southern-battlefronts | title=SYRIA UPDATE: THE SOUTHERN BATTLEFRONTS | publisher=ISW | date=5 April 2013}} that began in early February 2013 in and around the city of [[Damascus]]. On 6 February, rebel forces launched an offensive, named "Battle of Armageddon", on the edge of Central Damascus, with rebels entering the Jobar District of Damascus after overrunning a [[Syrian Army]] roadblock. Parts of the Damascus ring road which acts as a barrier between Central Damascus and [[Ghouta]] were also seized by rebel fighters. Rebels have also launched attacks on [[Adra, Syria|Adra]], north east of Damascus.{{cite web|last=Yacoub |first=Khaled |url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/02/06/us-syria-crisis-damscus-idUSBRE9150BD20130206 |title=Syrian rebels fight close to heart of Damascus |publisher=Reuters |date= |accessdate=2013-12-07}}{{cite news | url=http://www.nytimes.com/2013/02/11/world/middleeast/syrian-war-closes-in-on-the-heart-of-damascus.html?pagewanted=1&pagewanted=print | title=Damascus on Edge as War Seeps into Syrian Capital | work=New York Times | date=10 February 2013}} On 10 February, a rebel claimed that opposition forces had captured another military checkpoint in the Jobar district. However, [[Syrian Observatory for Human Rights]] stated that while fighting for the highway continued, government troops regained control of the area after bombing rebel positions the day before.{{cite web|last=Ginsburg |first=Mitch |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/syrian-army-rebels-battle-for-key-damascus-highway/ |title=Syrian army, rebels battle for key Damascus highway |publisher=The Times of Israel |date=2013-02-10 |accessdate=2013-12-07}} On 19 February, rebels began moving truckloads of anti aircraft weapons into Jobar in an effort to consolidate advances made in the Eastern Damascus district.{{cite web|last=Yacoub |first=Khaled |url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/02/19/us-syria-crisis-idUSBRE91I0GK20130219 |title=Syria Scud-type missile said to kill 20 in Aleppo |publisher=Reuters |date=2013-02-19 |accessdate=2013-12-07}} On 20 February, a [[SCUD missile]], fired by government forces, hit the command center of the [[islamist]] militia [[Liwa Al-Islam]] near [[Douma, Syria|Douma]], which had been spearheading the attack against the roundabout and the Jobar district. Sheikh Zahran Alloush, the commander and founder of the brigade, had been wounded in the strike. The area was devastated and other rebel fighters were also killed or wounded.{{cite web|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/02/20/us-syria-crisis-rebel-idUSBRE91J0D420130220 |title=Missile blast wounds Syrian rebel commander: activists |publisher=Reuters |date= |accessdate=2013-12-07}} On 21 February, rebels launched 3 car bombings on security targets in the [[Barzeh, Syria|Barzeh]] neighbourhood in Damascus. Also fired several mortar rounds at the Syrian army's general staff headquarters in [[Umayyad Square]], as well as other streets and squares known to house government and security offices, according to residents and activists. [[SOHR]] claimed that 22 people, mostly soldiers, were killed in these other attacks.{{cite web|last=Dagher |first=Sam |url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424127887323549204578317544181127314.html |title=Attacks in Damascus Target Symbols of Assad Regime - WSJ.com |publisher=Online.wsj.com |date=2013-02-21 |accessdate=2013-12-07}} On 27 February, SOHR claimed that rebels had fired several mortar shells which exploded in the military Judiciary and literature department of the [[University of Damascus]].[http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/syrian-forces-clash-with-rebels-around-aleppo-as-civil-strife-continues/2013/02/27/ee4a49fa-80dc-11e2-a671-0307392de8de_story_1.html ]{{dead link|date=December 2013}} On 2 March, heavy fighting was reported in [[Darayya]] between rebels and the Syrian Army. The [[Local Coordination Committees of Syria]] claimed that rebels targeted a military column attempting to storm Darayya, and also defended several attempts by the government to storm Jobar.{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-21641113 |title=BBC News - Syria: Fierce clashes in provincial capital Raqqa |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=2013-03-02 |accessdate=2013-12-07}}{{cite web|url=http://www.lccsyria.org/11032 |title=Syria Today 2-3-2013 | Local coordination committees of Syria |publisher=Lccsyria.org |date= |accessdate=2013-12-07}} On 3 March, rebels reportedly fired several rockets at security forces headquarters in Damascus, though it is unknown if there were any casualties.{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-21647196 |title=BBC News - Rebels 'seize most of Syria police academy' |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=2013-03-03 |accessdate=2013-12-07}} On 12 March, 30 military deserters were killed in an Army ambush near Damascus while they were heading towards the rebel-held Eastern Ghouta area.{{cite web|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/03/12/us-syria-crisis-ambush-idUSBRE92B0NT20130312 |title=Syrian forces kill 30 deserters in ambush: opposition |publisher=Reuters |date= |accessdate=2013-12-07}} On 18 March, rebels operating within Damascus launched mortar bombs at the [[Damascus Presidential Palace]], though its unclear if there were any casualties.{{cite web|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/03/18/us-syria-crisis-rebels-idUSBRE92H0V820130318 |title=Syria rebels say fire mortars at president's palace |publisher=Reuters |date= |accessdate=2013-12-07}} On 21 March, an explosion in the Iman Mosque in [[Al-Mazraa]] district killed as much as 41 people, including [[Sunni]] cleric, Sheikh [[Mohammed al-Buti]]. Al-Buti was one of the most prominent supporters of the Syrian government from the Sunni branch of Islam in Syria. Syrian State TV claimed the explosion was a suicide bombing, though some residents claim it was caused by a mortar bomb that struck a nearby political office.{{cite web|author=Jim Muir |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-21887877 |title=BBC News - Syria mosque blast: Pro-Assad cleric among dozens dead |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=2013-03-21 |accessdate=2013-12-07}}{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/liveblog/topic/syria-153 |title=Syria Live Blog - Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.com |date= |accessdate=2013-12-07}} On 25 March, rebels launched one of their heaviest bombardments of Central Damascus since the revolt began, with mortars reportedly hitting Umayyad Square, where Baath Party headquarters, Air Force Intelligence and state television are also located. The attack was launched when rebel forces advanced into the [[Kafr Souseh]] district of Damascus, and the Syrian Army retaliated with artillery launched from Mount Qasioun. ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} {{Syrian civil war}} [[Category:Damascus in the Syrian Civil War]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War in 2013]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Free Syrian Army]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the al-Nusra Front]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Syrian government]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving Hezbollah]]
